lines.text:
[as Hart is restrained on the operating table]
I am just going to cut away your shirt. You don't mind? The pain when I am going through the layers of skin will not be unendurable. It is only when I am able to cut on the inside that you will realize you are having... an experience.
Wasn't it Nietzsche, who said that unendurable pain merges into ecstasy?

[as Henderson goes into X's lab]
Hello, Doc!

[X turns the noisy machines off]
How's the old throat specialist?
It will be a pleasure, Henderson, to work on your throat... someday.

[He laughs nervously]
No, thank you, Doctor.
no matter what happens to me, this butcher shop won't be here tomorrow.
[om how he escaped being tossed out of a plane by the bad guys]
You see, chief, I kinda felt I couldn't afford to drown just yet as I wanted to see a lot more of Miss Arnold.
Stay where you are. I'm aiming at your heart.
You'll have to aim higher, brother, because muh heart is in muh mouth.

[opening the door and finding Edwards eavesdropping]
Edwards, if you prefer, I'll make stenographed notes of my phone conversations in the future. I'll save you the trouble of listening in.
That won't be necessary. I do as I'm told.
I'm sick of your spying. I've had it!
You know where my orders come from.
